forecast.name: This Afternoon
forecast.detailedForecast: A chance of rain before 1pm. Mostly sunny. High near 56, with temperatures falling to around 54 in the afternoon. West wind 13 to 18 mph, with gusts as high as 23 mph. Chance of precipitation is 40%. New rainfall amounts between a tenth and quarter of an inch possible.

forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Partly cloudy, with a low around 47. West northwest wind 5 to 12 mph, with gusts as high as 18 mph.

weather_report:
As the afternoon unfolds in Downtown San Francisco, the air carries whispers of past rain, mingling softly with the anticipated patches of sunlight that are beginning to break through. The chill lingers, framing the day with a coolness that hovers just above fifty degrees. The west winds, playing their familiar role, dance briskly at up to eighteen miles per hour, lending an invigorating edge to the atmosphere. A subtle chance of rain looms until early afternoon, but it seems like the sun might leverage some strength, pushing away the remnants of cloud cover to reveal a clearer horizon, albeit one still touched by the marine layer that often blankets the city’s charm.

Tonight, you can expect a blanket of partly cloudy skies, wrapping the evening in a gentle embrace as temperatures dip to about forty-seven degrees. It’s the kind of night that urges one to don a light sweater or jacket, perfect for a stroll through the quieter streets or along the waterfront, where the coolness of the breeze plays in rhythm with the thoughts of those who wander. With the crisp air, it could also be a fine time for an understated café visit, where you can sip a warm drink and watch the world go by, even as the evening settles into a calm serenity that captures the essence of San Francisco's allure.
